item.title: DNSSEC and DANE explained
item.description: In this post, you will learn how DNSSEC and DANE work together and how to configure DANE TLSA DNS records. DNSSEC (Domain Name System Security Extensions) The domain name system (DNS) is the phone book of the Internet: it tells computers where to send and retrieve information. Unfortunately, it also accepts any address given to it, no questions asked. DNSSEC adds a security layer to this phonebook. It uses digital signatures to make sure the information in the phonebook is trustworthy and hasn’t been tampered with.
